overall.overall_text: a)demonstrate basic communication skills; b)talk about familiar topics using simple words; c) use both verbal and non-verbal cues to understand spoken language; d) demonstrate an appreciation and understanding of aspects of the Native culture under study.

specifics.specific: talk about familiar topics using basic vocabulary (e.g., identify members of the family);
demonstrate basic communication skills by participating in simple activities (e.g., work with peers to classify objects in the classroom by colour);
follow simple instructions (e.g., by making a physical response - see Total Physical Response (TPR) in "Explanatory Notes");
respond appropriately to simple questions (e.g., Who are you? When are you going? Where are you going?);
listen to simple oral messages using both verbal and non-verbal cues (e.g., tone of voice, facial expression, gestures).

overall.overall_text: a) demonstrate basic communication skills; b) demonstrate a basic understanding of vocabulary and language structures appropriate for this grade; c) demonstrate a basic understanding of the reading process; d) demonstrate an appreciation and understanding of aspects of the Native culture under study.

specifics.specific: demonstrate familiarity with the writing system used in the program (alphabet or syllabics chart);
read simple words, using the alphabet or syllabics chart, pictures, and other visual aids;
participate in structured reading activities appropriate for the grade (e.g., read the alphabet or syllabics chart, match words to pictures);
use pictures and other visual cues to develop reading skills;
recognize words and language structures that have been introduced orally;
read familiar words aloud using pictures.

overall.overall_text: a) demonstrate basic communication skills; b) demonstrate a basic understanding of vocabulary and language structures appropriate for this grade; c) demonstrate a basic understanding of the writing system used in the program; d) demonstrate an appreciation and understanding of aspects of the Native culture under study.

specifics.specific: demonstrate a basic understanding of the writing system used in the program (alphabet or syllabics chart);
write the letters of the alphabet or syllabic characters correctly;
write simple words, using the alphabet or syllabics chart, pictures, and other visual aids;
demonstrate an understanding of words introduced orally by creating vocabulary lists for specific topics (e.g., words associated with the family, special days).
